parameters.name: CurrentPage
parameters.description: The page number of the page to return.

parameters.name: DealUserId
parameters.description: The ID of the account that handles the anomalous event.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The end of the time range during which the anomalous events are detected. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: milliseconds.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the anomalous event.

parameters.name: InstanceName
parameters.description: The name of the data asset.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Default value: **zh_cn**. Valid values:

*   **zh_cn**: Chinese
*   **en_us**: English

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return on each page.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The name of the service to which the table belongs. Valid values include **MaxCompute, OSS, ADS, OTS, and RDS**.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The beginning of the time range during which the anomalous events are detected. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: milliseconds.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The handling status of the anomalous event. Valid values:

*   0: unhandled
*   1: confirmed
*   2: marked as false positive

parameters.name: SubTypeCode
parameters.description:
The name of the anomalous event subtype.

> You can call the **DescribeEventTypes** operation to query the name of the anomalous event subtype.

parameters.name: TargetProductCode
parameters.description: The name of the destination service in an anomalous data flow. Valid values include **MaxCompute, OSS, ADS, OTS, and RDS**

parameters.name: TypeCode
parameters.description:
The name of the anomalous event type. Valid values:

*   01: anomalous permission usage
*   02: anomalous data flow
*   03: anomalous data operation

parameters.name: UserId
parameters.description: The ID of the account that triggered the anomalous event.

parameters.name: UserName
parameters.description: The username of the RAM user.

parameters.name: WarnLevel
parameters.description:
The risk level of the alert that is triggered. Valid values:

*   **1**: low
*   **2**: medium
*   **3**: high
